intro: Cruciata coronata var. occidentalis, commonly known as the Western Crowned Cruciflor, is a unique plant species characterized by its striking, crown-like floral structure. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many familiar cruciferous plants such as cabbages and mustard. The plant features small, yellow flowers arranged in a dense, rounded inflorescence that resembles a crown, giving it its common name. It is native to specific regions in the western United States and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and distinctive morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
